question: [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Transaction Order Dependency] If transactions in the input vector are not ordered by version, can this cause database constraint violations or state inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Version Casting Overflow] Can the version.0 as i64 casts at lines 537 and 540 overflow if version numbers exceed i64::MAX, causing negative version numbers in the database? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Index Casting Overflow] Can the index as i64 cast at line 546 overflow if WriteSetChange vectors have more than i64::MAX elements, causing negative indices? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Enumerate Overflow] Can the enumerate() call at line 545 overflow if the changes vector is extremely large, causing index wraparound? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Async Transaction Safety] Is the async function process_transactions() at line 478 safe to call concurrently with overlapping version ranges, or can race conditions corrupt the database? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Connection Leak] If process_transactions() panics or is cancelled after calling self.get_conn() at line 484, is the connection properly returned to the pool? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Transaction Context Loss] Can the database transaction context be lost if async execution is interrupted, leaving partial data committed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: insert_to_db()] [Diesel Parameter Limit] Can extremely large transaction batches exceed Diesel's parameter limit even after chunking, causing insert failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: insert_to_db_impl()] [Foreign Key Violation] Can the insertion order at lines 77-89 violate foreign key constraints if dependent records are inserted before parent records exist? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: insert_current_table_items()] [Deadlock Risk] Despite sorting at line 589, can the conditional WHERE clause at line 400 still cause deadlocks if multiple transactions update overlapping table items? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: insert_current_objects()] [PostgreSQL Lock Escalation] Can the object updates at lines 456-467 cause lock escalation in PostgreSQL, blocking other indexer processes or API queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [All insert functions] [Schema Evolution Attack] If the database schema changes (columns added/removed), can old indexer code write corrupted data to the new schema? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [All insert functions] [Null Constraint Bypass] Can clean_data_for_db() that removes null bytes accidentally set NOT NULL columns to empty strings, bypassing null constraints? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: insert_events()] [Unique Constraint Assumption] Does the code assume the composite key (account_address, creation_number, sequence_number) is unique, and what happens if the chain allows duplicates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Unbounded Vector Growth] Can the vectors for signatures, user_transactions, move_modules, etc. at lines 489-526 grow without bounds, causing OOM if transactions contain millions of elements? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Stack Overflow Risk] Can deeply nested WriteSetChange or Transaction structures cause stack overflow during pattern matching or clone operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: insert_to_db()] [Double Free Risk] After moving Vecs into insert_to_db_impl() at line 129, are they properly dropped, or can the retry logic at line 168 cause use-after-free? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/default_processor.rs] [Function: process_transactions()] [Partial Transaction Processing] If from_transactions() at line 487 fails midway, does it return partial results that get inserted, causing incomplete transaction data? (High)
